text: Activation of STAT5 by <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> relies on Janus kinase function but not on receptor tyrosine phosphorylation , and can contribute to both cell proliferation and gene regulation .
We have investigated mechanisms and consequences of STAT5 activation through the human <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> receptor ( IL-4R ) .

By functionally expressing receptor mutants in the murine pro-B cell line Ba / F3 , we could show that phosphorylated tyrosine residues within the <extra_id_0> IL-4R alpha chain <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> are dispensable for <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced STAT5 activity .

However , disruption of a membrane-proximal proline-rich sequence motif ( 'box1 ' ) in either subunit of the bipartite IL-4R abolished not only ligand - induced tyrosine phosphorylation of Janus kinases <extra_id_0> JAK1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> JAK3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , but also <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - triggered activation of STAT5 and concomitant cell proliferation .

A dominant - negative version of <extra_id_0> STAT5b <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , but not of <extra_id_0> STAT5a <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , interfered with <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced DNA synthesis in Ba / F3 cells , suggesting an involvement of <extra_id_0> STAT5b <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in the control of cell proliferation through IL-4R .

Reporter gene experiments finally showed that transcription from promoters of STAT5 target genes can be specifically induced by challenging cells with <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and that both <extra_id_0> STAT5a <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> STAT5b <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> can contribute to <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - triggered transcriptional control .
